page.title: 08CROOK-A RURAL COMMUNITY
page.content: THE LIFE STYLE HAS BEEN GREATLY INFLUENCED BY THE CLOSING OF THE VILLAGE SCHOOL,POST OFFICE,SHOP,AND THE CUTTING DOWN OF PUBLIC TRANSPORT DURING RECENT YEARS.CHILDREN FROM 5 YEARS HAVE TO TRAVEL TO SCHOOLS OUTSIDE THE AREA.WORKERS OTHER THAN THOSE LIVING ON THE FARMS NEED PRIVATE TRANSPORT TO REACH WORK IN KENDAL, WINDERMERE,OR AS FAR AFIELD AS BARROW OR LANCASTER.THERE IS NO DOCTOR'S SURGERY,BUT THERE IS A DISTRICT NURSE. THE GREAT WAR MEMORIAL HALL IS THE MEETING PLACE FOR THE YOUNG FARMERS CLUB,THE WOMEN'S INSTITUTE AND THE CROOK FOLK DANCE SOCIETY.TO RAISE MONEY FOR THE UPKEEP OF THE HALL,2 RUMMAGE SALES AND 2 WHIST DRIVES ARE HELD EACH YEAR,PLUS COFFEE EVENINGS, AND OTHER PARTIES ON FESTIVE OCCASIONS.
